results.title: Mad double!
results.creator_credit: Home Entertainment Holdings and Thirtieth Cemalux
results.brief_description: Featuring the slapstick madness of two of Hollywood’s most famous comedy duos, Abbott and Costello and Laurel and Hardy, this compilation video also includes excerpts from two Abbott and Costello films and their classic comedy sketch “Who’s on first?” and two Laurel and Hardy films, “Tit for tat” and “Another fine mess”.

results.title: Macrame
results.brief_description: This film gives an introduction to the craft of macrame, showing the basic knots and how they can be used to create chains, twists and spirals to give a variegated effect. The film also introduces the craft.

results.title: Mackintosh 1868-1928
results.creator_credit: Murray Grigor, Films of Scotland, International Film Associates and Scottish Arts Council
results.brief_description: Born in Glasgow in 1868, Charles Rennie Mackintosh was one of the first pioneers of modern design and architecture. Combining Scottish, Japanese and English influences, he created styles and designs which were not just ahead of his time but ones which stand the test of time. His contribution to the world of art and design is now recognised internationally. This documentary traces his career from his early paintings to his architectural commissions and the final landscapes. Mackintosh’s work was a complete reversal of contemporary design, he made decoration intrinsic to the whole.

results.title: Machining of metals
results.brief_description: Examines the principles of metal cutting and shows how efficiency has been increased by using cutting fluids and improved materials for cutting tools.

results.title: Machines to move the mail
results.creator_credit: Harvey Harrison and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The ideas of London’s Dollis Hill Research Station and of the Post Office of the future. Shows examples of automation in the post office such as “Alf” the automatic letter facer, and “Elsie” electronic letter sorting and indicating equipment, to illustrate the future of a completely mechanised postal service.

results.title: Machines like men
results.creator_credit: Bill Wright, Michael Latham, Philip Daly and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Prescient and fascinating document from BBC-TV exploring the prehistory of contemporary information technology; the filmmakers elaborate some of the [primitive] computer’s potentials: text and voice recognition, simple deductive logic, computer assisted design and voice synthesis. Enquires into the development of robots and the problem this creation poses for human beings.

results.title: Machines do work
results.creator_credit: Peck-Warrin Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of simple machines. Discusses the lever, the inclined plane, the pulley, and the wheel and axle. Shows the contribution of the machine to our everyday life.

results.title: Machines and the farm
results.creator_credit: Agricultural Engineers Association and Random House
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the wide variety of agricultural equipment produced in Britain, and a review of the increasing efficiency of farm machinery. Illustrations include combine sowers and harvesters; fertilizers; irrigation pipes and sprays; muck spreaders; pea harvesters; and precision planting machines. Equipment of the future is exemplified in remotely controlled electronic tractors.

results.title: Machines and metal
results.brief_description: A film about McPherson’s Limited (Melbourne) suppliers for 100 years of machine tools, Macson lathes, Ajax nuts and bolts, Ajax water pumps and the making of these items.
